topic.title: P2P Market place
topic.body: References to various P2P related economic opportunities that are not stealing or abusing anybody. References to illegal opportunities are OK, the only opportunities that ARE NOT OK are the ones based on stealing, abusing, creating environmental harm.

topic.title: Where can freelancers find remote software development jobs?
topic.body:
I'm aware of the 
http://www.freelance.com/
https://www.freelancer.com/
https://www.upwork.com/
but it would be nice to know, what other portals there exist for honest software development freelancing jobs that have nothing to do with stealing from other people's bank accounts? 
Thank You.

2_1AZjDLkfYwSmjM7ZJUf7HHnrF778augRMa.body:
Your question is equivalent to the following question: "Is there any way to stop the people, who You do not like, from using public infrastructure, roads, ships, planes, trains?"

The issue with that question is that if every one of us starts to be that picky, then we will no have any common infrastructure to use. None of us. Not me. Not You. Not the people, who You do not like.

To simplify my answer I offer the following translation of the question: "Is there a way to stop people from using hammers for slamming in sculls of other people?" How about banning all hammers and requiring "weapons licenses" or "license to carry"?

https://theintercept.com/2016/09/08/hillary-clintons-national-security-advisors-are-a-whos-who-of-the-warfare-state/

My observation about the current forum here is that my previous comments are the only comments here that go beyond choosing sides or expressing emotional expressions about side X or Y being Z or W. As an European I suspect that one of the problems of the whole American presidental "show" (it lacks democracy to qualify as an election) is that the American public accepts low quality political system the way they accept low quality goods from China and all of that with the absurdly high prices, just like the American educational system has. 

One of my relatives had one of his friends, a black American, come over, to Europe, on a vacation trip, and then at a dinner table I asked, why is it that the Americans are willing to pay so much to the American universities, when they could pay just a fraction of the tuition fee, if they studied in Europe and all of that when fully acknowledging that the European doctors, engineers, teachers, other professionals, are not worse than the ones with American diplomas? His answer was that an average American just does not think that far. 

It seems to me that the issue in this forum is very much the same. Only first emotions, no time taken for thinking. No wonder that all sorts of things go wrong that way.

If You surf around YouTube, look for videos about private security companies, then You'll find multiple videos, where they say it out directly that anybody, who is any good at the military business, works outside Government nowadays.

> [becoming](#comment_1_1FwTZnDZJjs2epEtq9yLy7m2P5kZ4TYqAR): 
>...
> As for Europe...."Ethnicity doesn't matter guys, culture assimilation does""Culture doesn't matter guys, multiculturalism does"^^^Every 'anti-racist' 'HATE-HITLER' believes both these things at the same time^^^
> So, under those conditions, how would Europe not also be American? The only difference is they don't have the constitution.
>...
"They", me as an European included, differ from America by the fact that Europe is a huge collection of very different cultures. The Finns and Italians are very different "breeds". The Germans and the French are also very different "breeds". If U ask, where does Great Britain fit in, then my opinion is that the GB and Ireland are essentially one block, just like the Baltic States are: the Irish have their own language, each of the Baltic states have their own language, yet they have common interests and common threats while actually competing with each other in many respects. 

One huge difference between mainland-Europe and America+GB seems to be that be the Italians-Greek-Spanish people lax and corrupt as they are, ultimately nobody gets away being an untouchable bully in Europe, not even the Italian mafiosi, because the centuries of in-fighting and killing of each other has had a cultural evolution effect in Europe, where the people, who stood up for themselves, regardless of laws, tended to have greater chance of survival. The Nazis with their WW2 were nasty and in a way stupid, but would the "black lives matter" movement in united states be even RELEVANT, if the blacks had SMART and SYSTEMATIC way of ENFORCING THEIR INTERESTS?  I emphasize the word "interests", not rights, because it's not that the "good guys win", only the strong guys win and strength includes multiple types of strength: military, economic, intellectual, propaganda, capabilities to utilize scientific achievements, etc. Not everything is good in Europe, but it is a fact that the America, mighty as it may be, specially after Europeans had run each other to ground with the WW2, is culturally still quite young and inexperienced. If it weren't, the kind of circus that takes place at the U.S. presidental campaigns just could not be happening.

One more thing about the difference between Americans and Europeans: the Soviet Union was nasty and repressive and I know that from first hand experience, because I have lived there as a child, as a local, not as some diplomat's child, but, even at the Soviet Union occupied territories some CULTURAL things were more "civilized" than the current presidental debate. For example, even the oppressors and high party members always addressed crowds with formality and formal respect. The core of the message might very well be translated to modern American english as "Fuck You, I'm the boss here and I tell You, what You must do or else...", but even that was said with formal respect and style and with full understanding that if You go too far, you will be just assassinated, just like many Soviet army officers and generals were killed by their subordinates, if the higher ranks went too far. The Americans have not learned that yet, regardless of their position in hierarchy. The Americans at the top do not seem to understand that if their audience were consisting of Europeans, then their current behavior would not be tolerated, and the Americans at the bottom do not seem to possess the capability to calmly sit down, think of a plan, how to actually enforce one's interests, and then execute the plan, in stead of just spontaneous yelling and banner waving.

> [becoming](#comment_4_1FwTZnDZJjs2epEtq9yLy7m2P5kZ4TYqAR): Everything you said, cloudofstars, boils down to the lack of history behind the U.S. Except, you're going the same direction as the U.S.Europe does not differ in direction. It only differs in history.
>...

At government level I agree that U.S. and Europe are at the path to the same hell-hole, where the government officials are not held accountable for anything, except that due to the bloody history Europeans have "better training" dealing with the situation, which of course, if some "European Exceptionism" is applied, also means greater responsibility to deal with the politicians before a new Hitler-and-Friends emerges. The new Hitler-and-Friends does not need to be Nazi at all, a plain dictatorship or 1984 will do. The new Hitler might even be with dark skin color, that won't make any difference.

>...
>  That does nothing, though, to excuse that every thing is defined both by what it was, what it is and that which it is becoming.
>...

I disagree on that one. To define something, one has to understand the terms that are part of the definition. The meaning of words, terms, expressions, depends on context. Context is influenced by the knowledge and mental capabilities of the person, who does the interpretation. So, the "what was", "what is", "what will be" part is totally dependent on the knowledge, education(not just "level", but scientists from different universities tend to work on different problems by using also different approaches), mental capabilities(sharp, drunk, young, too-old-and-mentally-retarded, etc.). I believe that Europeans tend to have a more analytical way of solving things, while American scientists and engineers like to experiment more and try more things out. Doing a lot of parallel experiments yields better results, when analytical capabilities are lacking, for example, when the system is too complex for current analytical methods. On the other hand, if there is enough skills and data to analyse, the experimental approach covers less corner cases than the analytical approach can cover.

Long story short, it's the Europeans, who must sort this mess out and we're not in shape for doing that. But, there is hope, some people are actually working on things.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IqlRAjauetw

> [scrub](#comment_131_1ADB7TdX2fVbTsWBoMe9yBTmVXTbb33b4R): The only this I like about Trump is that he is against the TPP. (I'm on the opposite side of the political spectrum. I vote for parties such as the Pirate Party Australia and the Australian Greens, left-wing progressive parties.)
I tried to find the Laura Flanders podcast, where she discusses the "socialism" phenomena and, according to my very subjective and anarchistic interpretation, reaches the conclusion that at its core the word "socialism" comes from word "social", referring to collaboration, but at the same time the collaboration does not necessarily have to be the old-fashioned state socialism, where hardworking people are robbed of the fruits of their hard work by taxation and that the main problem with Bernie Sanders and the British labor party and alike is that they all represent the old-fashioned state socialism, which dictates to people, how they must live and what they must do and offers the socialist party leadership a prosperous life at the expense of the taxed workers. 

The problem is that at the same time the free market side, the "capitalists" are shoddy at their game, allowing banksters and corporations to essentially do the same thing: wealth to the CEO's and economic misery to the people, who do the actual work. The Venture Capitals and whole idea that the banks loan the money and get back more money than they loaned, allowing the bank CEO-s to live a wealthy life without the bank producing anything or offering any service to anybody, is a testament to the fact that the free market advocates, who respect the rights to private property, who find taxation to be evil, and want different kind of business arrangements than the banksters do, just do not play their game, HAVE NOT GOT OFF THEIR BUTTS. Instead of clever plan and rigorous execution of that plan, there are some pathetic banner waving events with texts like "Occupy Wall Street". The "Black Lives Matter" is not about economics, but essentially the scheme is the same: parties, who suffer, wave banners in stead of rigorously carrying out a systematic, strategically though out, carefully crafted, plan.

And so the 2 sides just jell each other, the press earns a fortune on taxation supporter's propaganda, generally called "election campaing", and the press earns a fortune on selling advertisements to consumer goods sellers by getting the viewer count, click-count, up with the "Occupy Wall Street", "Black Lives Matter", and alike.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vN0H9ylpOL4

One thing to note is that the various spying agencies and "homeland security" establishments will be LOADED (with money( regardless, which of the 2 candidates wins, because Hilari is hawkish industry puppet (offering more of the same) and TRUMP hates free speech. I as a free speech advocate would still vote for trump, just to introduce any kind of change to the current, hopeless, system.

> [teszt](#comment_51_1AdcxsExVKvxffQtEd72E5tckouzZHLEYC): This kind of argumentation is not valid.It doesn't help to say to the millions of uneducated why they didn't became like Einstein or to the most poor who hunger why they didn't became a Rockefeller or to those bombed out from their villages why they didn't became a Napoleon.All this celebrities existed only once and they had the proper opportunities at proper time. Those who are not Rockefellers also want to live their lives.
> Globalization is inevitable in some areas: internet, IT and nobody has something against chip production in Japan.But on some areas globalization is unnecessary and destructive.Most people from Europe don't want to eat chlorinated American chickens from TTIP. To say that don't eat if you don't like doesn't help because nobody has scanner eyes and if they are in Europe then any chicken can be chlorinated.They are scientific studies that the excessive consumption of junk food is causing that America has the highest number of perverted individuals.At least Trump don't want to force to the TTIP.

Thank U 4 Your carefully thought out answer.

The TTIP or TTP or TPPA or what ever the marketing guys want to (re-)brand it has mailnly the same problem that exists in forums, e-mail lists,  non-anonymous internet (includig ZeroNet, which is not anonymous): the requirements of idiots and Einsteins differ and at some narrow context most people, me myself  included, are total, utter, idiots, and in some other narrow contexts, me NOT necessarily included, the same people, who are utter idiots, are actually, objectively speaking, Einsteins. The solution that I see is proper labeling. That works for e-mail spam, forums, books, poisoned chickens, poisonous toys, etc. The main obstacle that exists with both, physical products and information is that the producers of the poisoned chickens and poisonous toys want to apply deletion based censorship. 

I noticed You mention "scanner eyes". I think that modern cell phones, which can detect QR-codes, actually can be those "scanner eyes". Each person buys a paid subscription from a laboratory that runs a web service and if the laboratory screws up, mislabels goods, so that its clients die, then its business will not be so good. The current system in Europe is actually much laxer: the state inspectors inspect only the production facilities, the meat, grain, etc. and they do it very randomly, at a very low pace. My opinion is that people, who are that stupid that they will put their life on the line by depending only on some Facebook or Google subsidiary for food safety, then they deserve the health related, possibly fatal, consequences. Everyone must have the right to commit suicide and people must have the freedom to eat poison, if they think that this is fashionable, just like the old Romans did with their Pb based poisonous sugar that they used in their wines.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lead(II)_acetate#Sweetener

Besides, ethanol is also pretty unhealthy, but people do drink it and the tax men have figured out that they can even profit from that by using a nice propaganda excuse of "reducing the consumption of unhealthy chemicals" as their Public Relations stunt to cover up their deed.

All in all, the reason, why little children are not given much freedom is that it takes smarts to live in a free world, but  at the same time, restricting Einsteins to kidnergarten regime gives us Cuba and Soviet Union. Try explain that to the children in the kindergarten.

3_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS.body:
If You study the typical DHT algorithms, Kademlia and Chord

http://www.jurn.org/#gsc.tab=0&gsc.q=Kademlia%20DHT&gsc.sort=
http://www.jurn.org/#gsc.tab=0&gsc.q=Chord%20DHT&gsc.sort=

then first of all, it does not matter, if the nodes of the distributed hash table are addressed by using numbers that are IP-addresses or Tor network URL's, because ever URL is a series of characters and therefore essentially just a number, just like IP-addresses, and secondly, there exists the fundamental issue that in order for the nodes to find each other, there MUST be at least some nodes/vertices in the graph that are 

    TEMPORARILY 

common, a meeting place. You can imagine it this way that suppose there were internet links from Earth to every planet in the universe and suppose the internet links from one planet to another, regardless of the distance between the planets, was at most 1s of the time of every planet (which can not be happening, because in reality the Unvese is expanding and the due to the great speeds involved the 1 Earth second is going to be something very long at some distance galaxy that moves away from Earth, but for the sake of simplicity, let's ignore that physics). The important property of this model is that in a situation, where there are more interconnected planets than there are sand grains on Earth You may be connected, if You know the address, but finding out, where to connect to, is going to be with probability close to 0 without agreeing to some common meeting place. That meeting place does not have to exist at all time, id est a relay on some asteroid that crashes to some star is perfectly OK, as long as the data is exchanged before the asteroid hits the star. 

Long story short: for any of the DHT's, regardless of algorithm, to work, there must be at least some common meeting place for node clusters at some point in time. It's just that it's OK for war mongers and "authorities" to destroy that data exchange node or, even better, the exchange node should go offline by itself to hide itself from the adversaries and then self contact different parties to offer the exchange of data. (The "Hollywood principle: the protected party always initiates the communication with the non-protected parties.")

You may also find the works of Dave Ackley inspirationan, when developing agent oriented algorithms:

1_18Sh2Z83C23xdd6pjCq6NGv7Y6svEBcUfb.body:
As long as zeronet lacks a proper anonymizaton capability, which it does, all applications that give the users a false impression of anonymous communication, should be discouraged. 

What might help, though, is to create Windows installers and Linux source distributions that include a local server, a lot like the current Python script actually is, and commands to redirect everything through some actual anonymization services, more than one. GNU net, Tor. The Web browser based P2P has to be dumped due to lack of actual anonymity. 

A solution might also be to sell Raspberry Pi like computers, may be

    https://www.pine64.org/
    https://getchip.com/pages/chip

that people can put on their LAN and then surf the ZeroNet by logging into their personal server. Given that WiFi is not really safe and LAN's can be sniffed, the pairing might be that at first the server is connected to a monitor and a person then manually types a long random string from that server to the web browser, where a JavaScript application saves the random string to web browser database (all web browsers support that nowadays). That string is used as a key that expires within 6 months.
